adjectives.description: unlimber (comparative more unlimber, superlative most unlimber)

verbs.description: unlimber (third-person singular simple present unlimbers, present participle unlimbering, simple past and past participle unlimbered)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To deploy an artillery piece for firing (i.e. to detach it from its limber).
(by extension) To clumsily put into employ a large weapon or object.
To unsling something, as a backpack, carried on the body with a strap; to bring something carried into the hands for use.
To stretch muscles, limbs, etc., that have been cramped or unused for some time.
